title: Some Math On Veteran's Scars PBE Changes
body:
So currently Veteran's Scars gives .8/1.6/2.4/3.2/4% extra to total health. But on the PBE it gives 9/18/27/36/45 health. 

Now I was thinking this was to appeal more the carries as the flat health would be better instead of a measly 4% extra boost to health. However I was mistakenly wrong. 

To break even with the new 45 flat health you would only  need 1,125 health. That is not at all hard to get. Why are we nerfing this mastery so hard? 
It only benefits people in the early game but as soon as you get beyond 1,125 health it becomes worthless. The resolve tree was meant for tanks and what not. How in anyway is this helpful?

replies.body:
I'm not in charge of these changes, but one thing to keep in mind here is that changes to the early game power of something have a far greater effect than changes at all other points in the game. It's why reducing someone's base HP by 40 or base AD by 3 can result in substantial performance hits to champions.

I imagine this change is intentionally aimed at keeping it powerful in the early game (45 base HP is significant power, as noted above) without it scaling well into the late game. I do believe most the rest of the Resolve tree tends to scale _very_ well into the late game.

if veteran scars scaling was nerfed to make it a more attractive mastery thats impactful early game for carries and assassins, then the health could be put back into strength of the ages for those heavy fighters and tanks that invest more into the tree.

either way i also have another proposal. please reduce the health per cannon minion to 15 and make regular minions give 1 hp stacks. the problem is, that the mastery can be extremely unreliable when youre behind or getting zoned. missing out on that cannon minion really hurts if theyre the only source for stacks (besides jungle camps) and spawn rarely early on.

But they do belong to classes/archetypes with their current design. If you really wanted them to be neutral in all respects you would've made these trees with pure utility masteries like ms buffs, sustains, gold generation and so on... But that's not the case. There are damage increases and a bunch of heavy combat regen and hp. And tank stats are kind of outnumbered and only exist within resolve tree.
Right now there's 15 masteries that give some form of dmg increase,  17 that give utility(long term sustain, mana regen, cdr and so on) and just puny 8 masteries that give hp, heavy combat hp regen and resists, Doesn't seem really fair to tanks especially since regen is more of an offtank thing and leaves other tanks with only 1 viable build path within resolve tree...and you are going to nerf it's late game effectiveness in the next patch.

This game is revolved around damage for everything and when that damage is paired with mobilitiy, untargetability, invisibility, range and other utility that helps them to avoid taking damage (which lead to those "wtf" moments when we get bursted from a fizz or leblanc) resolve tree will never favour those champs especially if it's only 12 points into it. The resolve tree is meant for champs that favour the bit of durability over the utility they get out of Cunning and/or damage from Ferocity since they know they can't effectively avoid damage, these champs are tanks, fighters, a handful of immobile mages and most junglers.

Yet the only class I see actually willing to go 12 in Resovle tree after the flat hp change is marksmen. Cunning and Ferocity offer Mages and Assasins all the damage and utility they could get out of masteries and a minor 46hp at lvl 1 won't change that.

**Champions that I already take resolve points on:**

>Fighters especially the sustain ones (Though I take Runic armor over Veteran Scars and switch to the minor flat hp won't change that)

>Juggs and Tank with not a lot of hp sustain (These champs I go Veteran Scars on)

>Mages who have a lot of hp in their build or I build somewhat tanky {{champion:8}}{{champion:90}} {{champion:50}} (Veteran Scars but Runic armor also works good on swain and vlad)

>Most junglers, especially ones who take a beating on the first clears such as {{champion:203}} 

As you can see they are a fair amount of champions that will benefit more from the current Resolve Tree as a Secondary choice over Cunning. The only champs who will prefer the immediate flat hp at lvl one are champions that generally don't have much appealing hp items in their build paths which are Assassins and Marksmen. But who cares? Those are just 2 classes and frankly only the melee assassins will show intersest in Resolve over cunning. **Physical Damage Dealers still don't have their long awaited AD/Armor item** I can probably go another 2-3 paragraphs explaining why the % is better than the noob trap of flat hp you have on pbe but if what I say hasn't changed your mind then another 3 paragraphs definitely won't/

It's not fair it's the same thing as previous masteries. The offensive tree always looks like this %%%%%%%% allowing damage dealers to scale superbly into the late game whereas in the tank tree you get stuff like -2 less damage from champs, Flat hp, Flat resistances based on how many targets are in vicinity and so on.

Perhaps just moving the Veteran's scars down a tier would be more beneficial? That way if you want to get into that 4% extra hp you need to make some tough calls on the rest of your tree, without reducing the effectiveness of the tanks that spec solely into the tree.

Could tanks then also get a better secondary option?

If you want damage and damage, you can go resolve and cunning and you'll still get damage from your dip.

Thanks for replying to this thread. You did make a great point that it isn't mean for only tank champions. 45HP is pretty big early but falls off later in the game. 

Can we talk about Strength of the Ages. I don't see it being picked up very often or in rare cases. Such as Tahm Kench as he scales very well off of health. If this is meant to be the tank Mastery then why does it feel so awkward compared to every other Keystone. 

Take for example Bond of Stone gives a 2% Damage reduction but increases to 8% when near an ally. (Being changed to 3%/6% next patch from the looks of it) or Grasp of the Undying which makes you steal 3% of your HP from an enemy champion. These Keystone will always have a benefit at some point in the game. They'll always give you something. 

However. if you or an Ally missed the cannon then you are essentially delaying yourself. This Keystone feels like you are on the clock. If you don't have a great game or just certain things don't align then you are behind. It should take roughly 23 minutes if you get every cannon. Which is fairly balanced for the amount of HP you are being awarded. Not sure how long it would take as a Jungler as I haven't done the math on it. 

tl'dr Strength of Ages mechanics feels gimmicky at best. It's a stacking mechanic that'll give you a mediocre benefit if behind.

As a jungler, it is four full clears of the jungle, if you include the crab.  More likely, you'll get 6 or 8 in your first clear, then 4 or 5 in the next clear, and back to 6 or 8 afterward.  This would make it 6 full clears, each delayed by ganking, which is the real problem.

Strength of Ages encourages tanks to power-farm the jungle like they would with Devourer.  But tanky junglers, like Sej, Rek'sai, etc., tend to excel at early ganking.  The Keystone and playstyle are diametrically opposed to one another, while Bond of Stone synergizes with a tanky jungler's playstyle.

In my experience the best keystone for most Sej/Amumu style tanks is the one you didn't mention.

Grasp of the Undying is super strong on more offensive tanks since it procs off of your HP. When you have a lot of HP the mastery damage and heal get to be significant and since you don't die quickly it's not unreasonable to expect to proc it multiple times, especially since it gives you sustain to help with this.

>Strength of Ages encourages tanks to power-farm the jungle like they would with Devourer. But tanky junglers, like Sej, Rek'sai, etc., tend to excel at early ganking.

Sej doesn't and Rek'sai isn't a tank. 

Rek'sai's a fighter jungler at her core. She excels at early game pressure. This means the only tier 3 defence mastery you should ever consider on her is GotU. You honestly should probably stick to Fervor of Battle on her though, it's pretty much just the best keystone for anyone who can make good use of it.

Sej on the other hand has sub-par ganks pre 6. They're not Shyvana tier or anything but she certainly doesn't "excel at early ganking". She gets outperformed in early ganks by any traditional early pressure jungler, (hence the name) she picks up post 6 but she's still far worse at ganking than people like Lee and Elise.

Sej actually does play a farm game early. The only time you can really gank as Sej is when someone offers you the kill on a silver platter. You also do need to farm as Sej since she scales hard into the late game, her powercurve is very similar to a devourer jungler. 

I'd say overall Strength of Ages synergieses fairly well with Sej's playstyle, definitely better than Bond of Stone. The reason why Bond of stone is better is because 300 HP just isn't that good compared to other keystone masteries.

Could we look at Zilean in terms of which masteries are good on him?

Thunderlord's isn't that great because of the large window between Zilean's Damage points,

Stormraider isn't good because Zilean's burst is so delayed,

Deathfire Touch isn't good because Zil's damage is AoE, and so get's penalized

Windspeaker's blessing isn't good because His ult is the only healing he has on his kit.

Overall, none of the Keystone choices are good on Zilean, and it's sub optimal to go 15/15/0 on him.

Yo, I've been working on the changes to masteries with Squad5 and Stashu so thought I'd pop in and give some context.

There are 2 goals with the Veteran's scars changes this patch:
1) lower the degree to which tanks are hyperscaling with items.  
2) As Repertoir mentioned, make the tier 2 resolve tree more attractive to other classes who don't buy tons of health.

--- If you look at a list of the top junglers right now they're all champs who build tanky: Mundo, Skarner, Rammus, Nunu, Volibear, Amumu.  While some of this rise in power for individual champs is to be expected (Rammus wrecks ADC's and Trundle is strong whenever super tanks are strong), when a class as whole is standing out above their peers it's probably a good idea to look at the underlying power from systems that support that class.  In this case we feel the Resolve tree is offering too much multiplicative scaling to tanks in too many different places.  

**We feel that Veteran's scars is a great candidate for conversion to flat as it reduces the crazy item scaling tanks are getting right now, opens up the tree to more characters, and creates an easier to grok choice vs. the %healing and shield mastery.**

---Final note, some of you may be asking: "Why not just nerf Mundo? He's the real problem!" If it was just Mundo that's exactly what we'd do, but right now we're seeing immense strength across the whole class of characters so feel it's better to nerf a few masteries than hit 6 champs.  If this leaves some of the already  weaker tanks in a bind we're likely to buff them up. We had a similar thought process when we hotfixed Warlord's Bloodlust.  You can hit Yasuo, Trynd, and other early crit users, or you can look at the thing that they all have in common: crazy synergy with Warlord's.
